How about just prefix? IIUC, the following example:
              RequestContextExporter
                      .builder()
                      .setDefaultExportPrefix("foo")
                      .addExportGroup(
                              ExportGroup
                                      .builder()
                                      .keyPattern("client.*")
                                      .build()
                      )
.. does not make client.* have foo prefix, so it'll be confusing to say foo is the default prefix.
set could be omitted.
Yeah, .setDefaultExportPrefix(String) should be renamed to .prefix(String).

We can make those collections immutable.
For example:
builtIns = ImmutableSet.builder();
builtIns.add(...)
new ExportGroup(builtIns.build(), ...)
We can optimize this a bit by initializing this lazily. I think some features are not used when a user does not customize heavily. In that case, we can use ImmutableSet.of().
Use ImmutableSet.toImmutableSet()?

I think <exportGroup> is an optional feature. Don't we need to initialize this by default.
How about make it @Nullable and initailzed it when it is actually used.
Ditto. Use toImmutableSet()?
Add final?

 Note that a custom MDC key cannot be used with a wildcard expression `*` or `req.*`.
 
+### Specifying a prefix for MDC keys
+
+You can specify a prefix for MDC keys using the `<prefix>` element.
+If you want to add a prefix `armeria.` to all MDC keys,
+you need to add `<prefix>armeria.</prefix>` to the XML configuration.
+
+```xml
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<configuration>
+  ...
+  <appender name="RCEA" class="com.linecorp.armeria.common.logback.RequestContextExportingAppender">
+    ...
+    <!-- set the prefix of MDC keys -->
+    <prefix>armeria.</prefix>
+    <export>remote.id</export>
+    <export>req.headers.user-agent</export>
+    <export>some_value=attr:com.example.AttrKeys#SOME_KEY</export>
+    ...
+  </appender>
+  ...
+</configuration>
+```
+
+When you want to specify a different prefix, you can define `<prefix>`, `<export>`, and `<exports>` elements
+in the `<exportGroup>` element.
+
+```xml
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<configuration>
+  ...
+  <appender name="RCEA" class="com.linecorp.armeria.common.logback.RequestContextExportingAppender">
+    ...
+    <!-- set the prefix of exports which is not wrapped with the <exportGroup> element -->
